resources.string:
=>Start Point: oxi Square
 	=>Head north on Trikoupi
 	=>Turn right onto Achilleos
 	=>Turn left onto Areos
 	=>Turn right onto Onisilou
 	=>Turn left onto Xatzigiorgakis Kornesios
 On your right side is the House of Hadjigiorgakis Kornesios
\t=>Turn left onto Patriarchou Gregoriou\n \t=>Continue onto Plaeia Tyllirias\n On your right side is the Hamam Omeriye
\t=>Turn left onto Trikoupi\n \t=>Slight left onto Areos\n On your left side is the Mosque Omeriye

=>Turn left towards Areos
 	=>Turn left onto Areos
 	=>Turn left onto Liasidou
 	=>Turn left onto Trikoupi
 	=>Slight right onto Thrakis
 	=>Turn right onto Agiou Savva
 On your right side is the Agios Savvas Church

=>Turn right onto Aisxylou
 	=>Turn left onto Sofokleous
 	=>Turn right at Onasagorou
 	FANEROMENI CHURCH IS ON THE LEFT!!!!

The curch is dedicated to Panayia Faneromeni and was build in 1872-73 on a site where, according to historical reports, there once to a convent, built in the early 14th century. In 193, a new bell tower was added which was later fitted with bells manufactured in England in 1940-41. The magnificent woud-carvediconostasis dates backto 1659.On the iconostasis is a copy of an icon of Panayia Phaneromeni painted in 1924 by renowned artist Adamantios Diamantis. The original icon of the Virgin Mary after whichthe church is named was transferred to the Byzantine museum of Arcbishop Makarios III Foundation . Among the precious icons of the church are those painted by the famous Greek artist Kissonergis, including the "Platytera" at the pulpit, the "Pantocrator" and the four Evagelists at the dome
